title: Police launch urgent search for 30-year-old mother who went missing six days ago
text:
Police are becoming 'increasingly concerned' for the welfare of a mother who disappeared with her young children six days ago.

Emma Davies, from Priorslee, Telford, and her three children, Kenzie Birch, one, Amelie Vince, seven, and Laylah Vince, nine, have not been seen since October 19.

The fathers of three young children are 'distraught' and have said they want their children home.

West Mercia Police say they becoming 'increasingly concerned' for the welfare of the mother and her three kids following 'extensive enquiries' to locate them.

Emma Davies, 30, was last seen on Saturday October 19 after leaving her home in Priorslee, Telford, Shropshire

Emma Davies' children Amelie Vince and Laylah Vince who have gone missing

Superintendent Paul Moxley said: 'Emma has now been missing with her children for five days and it is really important we find them.

'The children's Dads are obviously distraught and want their children home.

'We're carrying out a lot of enquiries to try and find the family and I would ask anyone who has seen them, or has information about where they may be, to please get in contact with us.

'Even if they're not entirely sure if it is Emma, if they let us know we can check it out, even the smallest piece of information could lead us to find her.

'We would also appeal to Emma direct to please get in contact with us, she's not in any trouble we just want to make sure she and the children are all ok.'

Anyone with information is asked to contact the force on 101 quoting reference 728s 191019.
description: Emma Davies, 30, was last seen on Saturday October 19 after leaving her home in Priorslee, Telford, Shropshire, with her children aged between one and ten.
